body_html:
Thanks for your reply.

My algorithm needs 1 CNN forward and 1 256*256 matrix inverse.
Now the running time for CNN part is around 0.009s each image but the inverse operation takes about 0.70s which heavily drag down FPS.

My question is:
Can I first initialized 'inverse' somewhere by allocating the working memory and then reuse the cached ready function within the image loop to accelerate the computation?
I have tried this way but still got the same running time, ~0.7s.
BTW, I did inverse inside model.forward method, will the inverse be re-initialized for each forward computation and cause constant running time 0.7s?

Thanks

body:
Thanks for your reply.

My algorithm needs 1 CNN forward and 1 256*256 matrix inverse.
Now the running time for CNN part is around 0.009s each image but the inverse operation takes about 0.70s which heavily drag down FPS.

My question is: 
Can I first initialized 'inverse' somewhere by allocating the working memory and then reuse the cached ready function within the image loop to accelerate the computation?
I have tried this way but still got the same running time, ~0.7s. 
BTW, I did inverse inside `model.forward` method, will the inverse be re-initialized for each forward computation and cause constant running time 0.7s?

Thanks
